title: Executive Order 6007-Authorizing the Appointment of Carl R. Shepard
content: Carl R. Shepard, of Washington, D. C., may be appointed a junior construction engineer under the Office of the Supervising Architect of the Treasury Department without compliance with the requirements of the civil-service rules.

This order is recommended by the Secretary of the Treasury, who states that Mr. Shepard's services can be used to advantage in connection with the large building program in which the Office of the Supervising Architect is now engaged.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 6007-Authorizing the Appointment of Carl R. Shepard Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361562
